intro: Villebrunea frutescens, commonly known as the West African wild mango, is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of West Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by oval, fleshy fruits with a sweet, aromatic pulp. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts within its native habitat.
